Text:
Beta. Were you pestering Shadow for stories again
last night?

Yes, he was telling me a suspense story. The fairy
tale is called "Little Red Riding Hood," and the main
character is this young girl—

You found it very interesting, I see. It is written
all over your face.

(Oh, Lady Alpha has caught me red-handed. I did it
again... She's probably going to get mad now.)

...I-I'm sorry. I know I said that I wouldn’t take up
any more of Master Shadow’s time...
...It's fine. I am glad you seem better.
But...

I am sure that Shadow thinks the same, as he has been
seeing you nearly every day.

For now, I gave you a warning because it is my role
to manage the Shadow Garden, but I do respect his
decisions.
(Oh, good... She didn't get mad.)

But, just in case, I hope you haven't forgotten the
original purpose of the Shadow Garden?

The destruction of the Cult of Diablos and preventing
the resurrection of the demon Diablos—
I was hoping that you hadn't forgotten that.

However, the Shadow Garden is still small and weak.
That's why it is urgent that we create an organization
able to fight on equal footing with the Cult of Diablos.
Can you at least understand that?

So I think it is about time that you return to your
missions.

(Return to my missions...?! I have a place in the
Shadow Garden. That makes me happy, but can
I...really return?)

(I'm no longer having nightmares since Master Shadow
is reading me fairy tales every night...but if I return to
my missions...maybe the nightmares will also return...)

(Can I...kill our enemies...? Can I take up my sword
once more?)

(...It's not good to look backwards. I shouldn't―and
I don't want to―be a problem for Master Shadow or
Lady Alpha!)
What's wrong? Are you worried?

(As expected, there is no hiding my anxiety from Lady
Alpha...)

I see... I wish I could go with you, since I'm also
worried about sending you back on a combat
mission by yourself.

So how about starting with some intel gathering?
That should be okay, shouldn't it?
Intel...gathering...?

(If I don't need to...kill anyone, perhaps I can do
that, at least...)
...I-I can do it.
Good. I will be counting on you then.

Historical cities usually have buildings through
which their history is passed down―normally
called libraries.
...So big.

Before my eyes is a huge towering library, its size
almost in proportion to the age of the city.

As expected, big cities have grand libraries. First,
I'll get permission to go in... Then I guess I'll start
with demographic statistics.

Increases or decreases in population are said to be
a basic guide to the prosperity of a city.

Once you know the population, you can work out tax
revenue, military strength, and financial clout.

Intel can't only be gained from protected,
confidential information.

I can repeat what Master Shadow and Lady Alpha
taught me again and again, but... Ugh, maybe it's
still too difficult for me.

Even if they said I can gather something from here,
with all these numbers and difficult words... Hmm...

But this is the mission that Lady Alpha has entrusted
to me. I can't let her down.

I stay in the library half of the day, but before
I know it, it is closing time.

What... It's that time already...? All the library-
goers are suddenly gone... Hmm... All I can do
is run my eyes over this data as best I can...

I am supposed to write a report. What should I do...
I won't achieve any good results like this.

Lady Alpha didn't give me a deadline, but I can't
rely on that. Right! Even if it's evening now, I will
do my best!

I couldn't achieve any results at all during the
day―

On the other hand, it's quieter at night, so I can
continue my research in peace. Also, I don't
need to worry about checking out anything.

...So this is the atmosphere of a library at night.
Silence and...just a little moonlight filtering down
from the skylights...
The moonlight is bright enough that I can still read.
But...isn't this library a bit unsafe?

The security at night is a bit sparse, and there is
only a key for the entrance. It'd be quite easy to
break in.

But that said, unlike the Royal Library, there aren't
any collections of valuable old documents or books
on magic. I doubt anyone would steal these books.

Thanks to that though, I am free to read the books
here to my heart's content! Oh...a life surrounded
by books is wonderful.

Now to work! To start...I should carry on researching
the data from earlier today, but maybe I'll begin with
this easy-to-read "History of the Founding of the
Kingdom of Midgar."

Hmm, a lot of things happened in the capital. These
records cover not only the capital but even local
cities. It seems like the Kingdom of Midgar has a
rich history.

But...these historical terms? Some are difficult...
I might not be able to fully understand the details
without using a dictionary.

Hmm...this is going to take time. I think I'll take
a break.

Wow... I didn't notice in the daytime, but this
library doesn't just have dry, boring books.
There are a lot of light novels, too.

Ah, "The Warrior Princess and the White Wolf" and
"The Wise Dragon and the Messenger of Light". I've
heard that these classics are popular recently...they
look interesting.
I can't, I can't. I am here on a mission...

(But...if it's just a little...Yeah, I am on a break.
It's okay. I can read during my break...)

Not only is this easy to read, the sentences really
draw me into the world of the story... Writers are
amazing.

Even classic masterpieces... Wow, I thought classic
literature would be hard to read, but these kinds of
stories, handed down over decades, have a quality
you don't find in recent books.
I want to get comfy and read all of these.

How much time has passed? I come to my senses when a
draft suddenly caresses my cheek.

Oh no... I was just going to have a short break.
I got completely lost in the world of this story!

Of course I really enjoy the fairy tales that Master
Shadow tells me, but these stories in the library
are so great, I lost track of time and...
Time... Time...?
...Oh! I completely forgot about the mission!

Huh, wait a sec...was that a draft? But all the
windows should be shut... Is someone here?!

In the silence of the library, I can feel a slight
draft.

(Oh no! Has Lady Alpha come to check on me... Wh-What
should I do! She'll scold me!)
M-Master Shadow...?!

Ah, there you are. You're here pretty late. Are you
turning nocturnal?

I-I'm sorry! I...forgot about my mission... Please
forgive me!

Huh? Mission? You didn't come to hear my fairy tales
tonight, so I thought it was a bit strange.

So I asked Alpha, and she said you had gone to the
city library, and I thought I'd come check up on you
while I was out on my nightly walk.
I'm interrupting your mission, huh.

Not at all! Rather...I was kind of resigned to being
scolded... U-Um...

Oh... Were you reading that? Ah, so that's the kind
of book you like.

No, I mean...I was taking a break, so...erm, I wasn't
intending to slack off. But I suddenly realized how
much time had passed...
That's fine, isn't it?

I told you before, remember? Intel can't only be
gained from protected, confidential information...
Y-Yes! I remember!

So even if they're not difficult or technical, to put
it in an extreme way, there are books which get
labelled pointless, trashy, or vulgar―

Even if each book contains questionable things,
I think that there are universal truths that can
be seen when all of that junk wisdom is piled
together.

Even if it is all junk, when you pile them together,
you can see universal...truths?

Yup. No one can decide the value of wisdom. The more
wisdom you have the better, don't you think?
...At least, I think so.
Y-Yes...
That's all. Anyway, off I go.

There is a gust of wind, and in that moment, Shadow
is gone.
...There he goes.

Ah, I didn't get scolded even though I was slacking
off. Thank goodness...or not? What was he trying
to tell me...?
